subtitles.transcript: There are some arguments that I’ve heard made
that enrolling more students from out of state helps increase the diversity of the campus
and certainly that’s true from a regional geographic perspective,
but it’s not true from an income perspective,
it’s not true from an ethnicity perspective
and it disadvantages Californians if the counterfactual is that the state had provided
adequate funding for those slots for California students.
So at the end of the day, I understand what UC says, it makes sense.
From their perspective, if they didn’t enroll those students,
then there would be less money for California students,
there would be lower enrollment. Their budgets would be lower then
and they would have to do something about cutting faculty, cutting classes, something
to save the money that they were losing by not enrolling those students.
So I understand that argument, but it’s not the best case scenario.
